result.execSummary:
The defendant Gilberto Cajigas-Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or civil judgment. Restitution is set at zero.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.

No firearms; weapons.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibts possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
No contact with victim, Maria R-I without court approval. Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterer's Intervention" counseling and continue programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Today, go to Room 500-A for DV intake.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gilberto Cajigas-Rodriguez in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DOC agent Juan Ramos also in court.

Statements to the Court by M.R. regarding the No Contact Order.  Court will allow the agent to modify the No Contact Order; parties may have contact but may NOT live together.

Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Gilberto Cajigas-Rodriguez in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.
Probation Agent, Juan Ramos, is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.  Court will allow modification of No Contact Order if probation agent and victim agree to do so.
Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.   mld

Defendant Gilberto Cajigas-Rodriguez in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin with Jaclyn Schwartz (under the student practice rule)  
 Sworn as Spanish Interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew. 
The Court finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

 AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #3), in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 16 MONTHS.  

 AS TO COUNT #3: Defendant sentenced to serve 2 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 16 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Maria R-I without court approval. 
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
* Today, go to Room 500-A for DV intake.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 11-14-2014 AT 1:30 PM.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld
Sworn as interpreter:  Alexandra Wirth.   mld

Defendant Gilberto Cajigas-Rodriguez in court with attorney Heather L Johnson.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Sworn as Spanish Interpreter: Alexandra Wirth. 
Pursuant to plea negotiaitons and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS #2 and #3: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-16-2014 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including the no contact order, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Gilberto Cajigas-Rodriguez in court with attorney Heather L Johnson.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gilberto Cajigas-Rodriguez in court with attorney Heather L Johnson.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty on all counts. Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of discovery from the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-30-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Maria R-I

Defendant Gilberto Cajigas-Rodriguez in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Gilberto Cajigas-Rodriguez in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant pled not guilty on misdemeanor counts 2 & 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Gilberto Cajigas-Rodriguez
Current: 838 S 12th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 04-04-2014)
Prior: 1623 West Bolivar Avenue #3, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
